Text: I cry aloud to the LORD; I lift up my voice to the LORD for mercy.
Context: This verse introduces the Psalm as a prayer for mercy and sets a tone of urgency and need.

Text: I pour out my complaint before Him; before Him I tell my trouble.
Context: The psalmist is in a state of distress, expressing his troubles and sorrows openly to the LORD.

Text: When my spirit grows faint within me, it is You who watches over my path. In the way where I walk, they have hidden a snare for me.
Context: The psalmist feels overwhelmed and expresses a sense of vulnerability, acknowledging God's providence even as dangers are present.

Text: Look to my right and see; no one attends to me. There is no refuge for me; no one cares for my soul.
Context: The sense of isolation is palpable as the psalmist notices the lack of human companionship or assistance in his plight.

Text: I cry to You, O LORD; I say, "You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living."
Context: In contrast to the loneliness, the psalmist declares trust in God as his protector and provider.

Text: Listen to my cry, for I am brought very low. Rescue me from my persecutors, for they are too strong for me.
Context: The psalmist pleads for God's intervention, admitting his own weakness in the face of his enemies.

Text: Bring me out of prison, so that I may give thanks to Your name. The righteous will gather about me because of Your good treatment of me.
Context: The psalmist equates his situation to being in a prison and seeks deliverance as a means to thank and praise God.

Text: And surely the righteous will praise Your name; the upright will dwell in Your presence.
Context: There's an anticipation of vindication and fellowship with God, concluding the psalm with a note of hope for justice and community.
